cause.description:
Patchwork is a runaway and homeless youth shelter for youth ages 11-18. They work in correlation with Turning Point, a group home for older adolescents which provides independent living skills in a homelike atmosphere and New Connections, a variety of support groups, a GED classroom, job readiness training as well as an Independent Living program with on and off site apartments for youth.
All of DAYMARK's programs are voluntary and are available to youth regardless of race, ethnicity, gender, disability, or sexual orientation.
Join WNC Delta Lambda Phi National Social Fraternity for the gay, bisexual, and progressive male in supporting this organization.
